author: David
message:
For zoom-to-fit, actual-size, etc., would it be feasible/sensible to do something like.... on the actual slider there are little icons and markers and point to the places on the slider that correspond to zoom-to-fit and actual-size? And if you click on them, they go there. (And maybe a bit of snapping if you stay near them for a significant amount of time? Although, that could get annoying.)

Or would this not be all that nice?

author: Leo S
message: Looks nice. The only concern being that it may not be obvious to people that this is a zoom function. Perhaps actually write Zoom in the status bar next to the controls to make them easier to find.

author: Fri13
message:
Can i still hide statusbar? because it is Ugly...
If user cannot hide statusbar and have nice clean picture viewer, application can come a useless because customisation is forgetten.

That is one thing what is keeping KDE4 still away from good usability.

All GUI should be design to be very easily to customize with large amount of options. But it's very important to do _default_ settings to be for them who dont know/like to customise their applications.
KDE is going wrong direction if there ain't coming soon (4.1 - 4.2) all those options to customise GUI. Gwenview seem to go to direction where many starts looking other applications because Gwenview try to do everything else than just allow easy picture viewing and browsing, default should be just simple viewer but then allow sidebar what gives all other non-view options like rotate and other stuff.

That zoomslider should be possible to move from statusbar to somewhere else if wanted. Make it work as "pop-up" in fullscreen when mouse goes to spesific place but not so that statusbar pop up, but more like on aperture has own toolbars on fullscreen.
But most important thing is that slider can be moved away from there if wanted.
And then there should be alot cleaning Gwenview toolbar like, why there are double of rotate picture when sidebar is showed?

Just for my 2 cents

author: Aurélien
message:
@Fri13: I am not satisfied with the current look either. I am going to try to achieve something similar to Picasa zoom slider, at least the way the zoom-to-fit and reset-zoom buttons are set.

I may also add a "hide statusbar" item, but I am not sure about it yet.

author: Fri13
message:
@Tregar: It's not about the style, it's about status bar itself. It takes space from picture. It adds distortion for view because there are bars top/bottom side of image. But it might help if that bar is 50% transparent with gray/black effect, if that is possible?

Default look should always be like all other KDE apps as they follow systemsettings settings. It's usability question if not all buttons and "action" buttons look same when using different applications. This is one problem on windows, like Nero GUI is very different than somekind other burning tool or those sound / 3D card control panels what are themed to something else than Windows theme.

I suggest that zoomslider can be deattached and attached to somewhere other toolbar and hide statusbar then. By default it can be there if it's better for new users.

I use alot Digikam and i feel it bad to have zoomslider and next/preview image controls on statusbar. And if i want statusbar away, I loose controls too.

Many laptops has screensize 1280x800 and on those it is need to fight to save every pixel in vertical size. New EEEpc has 1024x600 screen and there it's more important to get all pixels away what isn't needed. Even that now typical new LCD monitor what is buyed is 22-24", it is important that all pixels are saved what just can be saved.
